skill.name: water-rights-fishing
skill.description: Clerk for water licenses, irrigation, riparian rights, and fishing restrictions affecting Pukaist/Nlaka'pamux; use for Water_Rights_Fishing queue.
skill.summary: Clerk for water licenses, irrigation, riparian rights, and fishing restrictions affecting Pukaist/Nl...
skill.author: ACSKamloops

security_audit.summary: Prompt-only skill containing instructions for AI clerk role. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond its own directory. Purely a set of guidelines for document analysis.

content.user_title: Transcribe water rights and fishing evidence
content.value_statement: Process and index historical documents related to water licenses, irrigation systems, and fishing restrictions. Ensures factual, legal-grade transcription with proper provenance tracking.
actual_capabilities: Fetch and process Water_Rights_Fishing task batches
Read JSON input files containing document data
Analyze water license and fishing restriction documents
Apply Legal-Grade Verbatim Protocol for transcription
limitations: Does not execute external Python scripts directly
Does not access filesystem outside its instruction directory
Does not perform OCR on images
Does not connect to external networks or APIs

use_cases.title: Document water rights
use_cases.description: Extract and index water license records for Pukaist/Nlaka'pamux territory from historical archives.

use_cases.title: Transcribe fishing laws
use_cases.description: Process fishing restriction documents for court audit trails and evidentiary purposes.

use_cases.title: Preserve irrigation records
use_cases.description: Index irrigation ditch and water dispute documents related to Reserve No. 10 and 11.

prompt_templates.title: Fetch task batch
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch a Water_Rights_Fishing batch for processing.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze document
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the water rights record for Pukaist Creek. Extract the date, title, provenance, and key evidence quotes.

prompt_templates.title: Batch processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Process the entire batch. Remember to re-read instructions after every 5 tasks to prevent context drift.

prompt_templates.title: Submit analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Submit the completed analysis JSON for the Water_Rights_Fishing queue with all required metadata fields.

output_examples.input: Analyze this water rights record about Pukaist Creek irrigation ditch construction.
output: Document: 1913 Letter from O'Reilly to Ditchburn
Relevance: High - details irrigation ditch affecting IR10
Key Evidence: 'Construction of new flume on Pukaist Creek authorized for Reserve No. 10'
Forensic Context: Records acreage reduction of 20 acres from 1878 survey

best_practices: Always read full document text before making relevance judgments
Re-read instruction file after every 5 tasks to prevent context drift
Use only factual language; avoid words like suggests, implies, likely
anti_patterns: Do not use keyword matching alone; read full context
Do not skip context refresh protocol after 5 tasks
Do not use speculative language in analysis

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code AI tools.

faq.question: How many documents can I process per batch?
faq.answer: Batches contain aggregated document blocks up to 40,000 characters for continuous context.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Use the refinement_workflow.py script to get and submit tasks through the Water_Rights_Fishing queue.

faq.question: Is my data secure?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no network access. Source files remain in read-only WORM storage.

faq.question: What if documents fail OCR processing?
faq.answer: Use flag-task with reason OCR_Failure to automatically move files to Vision Pipeline for reprocessing.

faq.question: How does this compare to general document skills?
faq.answer: This skill enforces legal-grade standards with strict provenance checks, verbatim requirements, and anti-laziness protocols.
